kDmhwPUHwfGZxKlszEFnKg.text: Yum yum yum yum! Eggs Benedict Royale (with salmon) a must.Milkshakes are great!There's usually a long line (boo) BUT they come and give you some treats while you are waiting to make them just rock (and hence why I ended up with a milkshake there in the first place).I actually think they are a bit pricey for breakfast/brunch food but it's liveable and a good spot on a Saturday/Sunday morn-noon.

hUiE2zvppA1MdAbIy1i7kQ.text: Ugh. After I asked the waitress for her suggestion I went with the Green Eggs and Ham. I think the meal would have been tasty had my scrambled eggs not been super watery and my wedges taste as if they were fried hours earlier and kept warm under a heating lamp.I wasn't impressed with the service, prices and food so I can't say I am tempted to try it again.

jHxkFuFh4sS-tT9ncRzOnQ.text: I come here from time to time as I only live a short walk away. And yes, tucked away in lovely Camden Passage, it is a nice place to go to take in the relaxing ambiance it provides. However, I agree with Derry N's review regarding the service. Though the staff are friendly enough, from the times I have dropped by, service has just been rather slow, from waiting to have the orders taken to waiting for the food to be served. However, I highly recommend the breakfast menu, especially the all American, and their choice of smoothies and fruit juices pack in a healthy punch of delight. However, aside from the breakfast menu, I wouldn't really go for anything else. Last time I went I had a pie of some sort, which tasted fine, but having had only been there for their breakfasts every other time, in comparison them, it was a disappointment. This might have a little to do with the fact that this little establishment has the word 'Breakfast' in its title, making one feel not quite at ease to be eating lunch/ dinner food when the restaurants' name suggests otherwise!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

2WPrbc1uwOHxGLIa-8snlQ.text: I used to love coming here, especially as breakfast is served until 5pm, but it's no longer a favourite of mine. Shame, as the cute location and variety of breakfasts used to make it top of my list.We went for a late breakie today, ordering a full english and the spanish version with chorizo sausages: neither were anything special. The chorizo was extremely greasy, with plasticky skin that I actually abandoned as I got bored of chewing, whilst the sausage on the english breakfast was completely tasteless. The hash brown was super disappointing... just a pile of over cooked potato cube/mush sort of thing. Named "The Full Monty" and priced at a hefty £8.50 the full english looked more like a half portion. I deffo wont be going back and the only reason they get two stars instead of one is because the staff are really nice and chirpy and the blackcurrent smoothy was a treat (well at £3.50 it should be). Maybe it's getting away with sliding a little, well a lot, because of it's hip reputation, but really what has happened to you BC?! if you want to spend this much on a breakfast I'd seriously recommend going to Roast instead.

GqCEBIXCgy65EXA6h4fv_w.text: I was hoping for better thing given all the positive things I'd heard from friends (though to be fair, just before heading there I had Laura N. tell me not to go in with high expectations).  I got the full monty.  The black pudding and sausage had too much oats in it so was really bland and a bit off consistency wise.  I believe the eggs were cooked at a really high temp or something because, although the yolks were still a bit runny, the whites were super dry and chewy/spongey.  The breakfast potatoes (which were not hashbrowns as stated) were mediocre as was the rest of the breakfast.  I'd go back and give it a second chance if I was with friends that hadn't been and wanted to give it a try, otherwise I'll likely stay away.

AOg4zG2HAyuUa8pGWjbJaA.text: I am an absolute sucker for the signs outside The Breakfast Club. Yesterday I found myself dragged inside by their cunning use of Bon Jovi lyrics, 'Standing on your mamma's porch you told me this would last forever...', an unusual technique for pulling in customers I think you'll agree. This sense of humour runs right through the restaurant and the staff, while not the fastest in the world, are always very friendly and up for a chat. The great breakfast is the reason that most people come which is better and more reasonably priced than any of the neighbouring pubs. My only criticism would be a lack of continuity from the kitchen. Portion sizes never seem the same from one trip to the next, nor to the person sitting two tables away.  Regardless of this I know I'll be back as I can't help the pull that Bon Jovi has over me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

7zsphkm-5MtWwWP7qQd_xw.text: This place can really make you happy to be up in the morning, with or without a hang over. First of all, the vibrant yellow is enough to wake you up, if haven't yet done so.Secondly, They have an amazing range of breakfast items that will almost cure a hangover. Besides the breakfast, there are a lot of sandwiches and salads on offer. They do actually offer a smoothie called the hangover boost smoothie, which claims to be a Soho favourite.This place really does have a lot of character. My favourite thing about it is the polaroids that are scattered all over the walls. I think they give it a really personal touch. The place is usually buzzing, especially on weekend late mornings.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

awavyi6rwU8d4M3fZzQs6g.text: Uming and ahing between 3 or 4 stars here so don't judge me unkindly BC. I do like this place but I thought it could be somewhere I loved and it just didn't work out for me. I went on two consecutive days; once on my own then again with friends for brunch but, due to tube nonsense, brunch turned more into lunch as I didn't actually get there until 12ish on both occasions. The location is great, the cute and cosy little café fits right in in this cute and cosy little alley. As it is so cute and cosy seating is a bit of a sticky issue, I think there's less than 10 tables all together and the first time I went I had to wait 10 minutes to get a table, second time 15 minutes and there's nowhere really to stand except for; in the way, by the door.Once you're seated the menu is really good. I had the Fully Monty breakfast and the American breakfast which were both dead tasty. Sausages and bacon were a little tough but excusable, the eggs were amazing, I've never, ever been able to scramble an egg to make anything but rubbery mess so I'm always impressed when that goes right. First time I ever put syrup on breakfast but, my god, you Americans have it right. Sugar + fat is always a winning combination.Good coffee, very good infact although I prefer the mint tea which is actual mint leaves in boiling water. It just never crossed my mind that it was possible to make mint tea from .. mint but now I know I fully intend to exploit this to show off my "indie" tea credentials. Who needs teabags? Service seems .. inconsistent shall we say. First visit got a lovely waitress who was attentive and I got my food and tea straight off the bat and had a chat with her afterwards. Second time around the service was friendly but slow; we were going to have dessert but by the time the waitress remembered to bring us the menus we decided to go. Price was ok I guess. £8 for a big breakfast, under a tenner for most stuff and you can get various breakfast items for under a fiver. Tea for £2 was pushing it a bit but they had nice mugs so .. what the hell. The worst thing about the experience was having to sit next to the world's wankiest graphic designers talking very loudly about implementation, facilitation, engineering experiences and creating a user-guided feedback system but you can't really blame this place for it's hipster clientèle. Well, maybe you can a bit since it does appeal to the hipster but I'll let that slide. 3 stars because I would go again and probably again and again but that's more because I'm a creature of habit than because of the place itself.

dUqnekhL2CSbOs64aHyzGQ.text: The Breakfast Club is not for dinner. Fact. They don't even really serve brinner, just a tired fry-up and pancakes. Linzi wants Eggs Royale at 9pm dammit. Yes their 80s kitsch props and movie posters are cute, but their horrible veggie burrito is not. Everytime I go in here they are Godawfully slow. I cannot wait over 30 mins for food, I'm hungry now. I've had better breakfasts for £3.99 at a greasy spoon than this hip pretender. The Breakfast Club.. you shame the hallowed memory of John Hughes.

uc0y1F8AlnvhwT4ZfwB8fQ.text: I love the interior and nearby exterior of this place. Every time I go it feels fun and quirky but also not overcrowded. I've tried the coffee, smoothies, and also the full monty. Everything was pretty standard, nothing especially jumped out at me, taste wise, but still it's a place I enjoy meeting people at.

xFL5ZgXzYjJDWzbebBcIMg.text: I have been three times recently and I love it. Great coffee, lovely breakfast and a no fuss and easy going attitude. Just the ticket if you want a catch up with a friend with minimal trouble. They also don't try and budge you from your table too easily either. But be warned this place fills up fast so get a table early or expect to be standing for a long, long time.

vHFIIQGJZilf_jSvuAULIg.text: Emilio Estevez and Anthony Michael Hall sighting hopes aside, I do often find myself sitting in the big bay window of the Breakfast Club and loving every minute of it. Sure, maybe I stare out the window for uncomfortably long periods of time, hoping for a glimpse of an '80s star gone awry, (perhaps Molly Ringwald strolling aimlessly down Camden Passage...) But even without celeb sightings, BC is still an utter classic in my mind. Delicious breakfast (who'da thunk?) with a nice mix of both American and British faves, tasty smoothies, and a friggin' fantastic lemon ginger tea all in a wonderfully fresh and cozy atmosphere.  Ok, ok, I guess it's fair to say service has been spotty a time or two, but most times I'm to busy, um, "people watching" to notice.  (An EE or AMH sighting would boost their rating to eleventy billion stars.)

0TvK0QPeoMcbqIlWZ-Bs4Q.text: Yummmy!! Yes the 11:00am Sunday morning line up can be quite annoying, but it is definately worth the wait! They have an 80's theme with the pictures and the music. The waiters seem quite friendly. It is fairly small place, so everyone is squeezed in tightly. As for the food I was quite impressed with their hollaindase sauce, so you can't go wrong with any of those options. The pancake is more like a crepe but tastes good with maple syrup. I was thrown off and not too impressed with the falafel offered in Veggie all American meal. But overall good way to start of Sunday morning!

iWW15C67Ru_6UYkESAG5wg.text: So good!  I wish the BC was closer to me so I could walk to it more often.  I first came across the Breakfast Club when trying to find somewhere to hang out late and study over some coffee (as late night coffee houses seem to only be a mainstay of North America), and although tiny inside, it packs a punch that brought me back to highschool when we'd sit around and eat fries and drink coffee and talk about how nobody understood us (teen angst is the best).The seating, the decorations, 80s / 90s memorabilia, it all makes it impossible not to smile while you're waiting for your food. The food was great, I've had burgers, breakfast, sandwiches, smoothies, daiquiris, coffee, etc etc etc and have yet to be disappointed.  Prices are fairly reasonable as well. They're open late (for the area) so take advantage of it if you've come out of the cinema or don't want pub grub as it's usually pretty quiet in the evenings.  Do be warned: weekend breakfast/brunch rush can make for a queue 20-40 min long (worth it though, I think).  If you're wanting to give it a try but can't wait that long, I've been told there's a new one by Hoxton square and they're meant to be bigger, so I'm assuming the wait would be considerably less (speculation).  But if you live in Islington or are a frequent visitor of Angel/upper st, don't pass this place up!!

j4gTndQE6xLDleeDL0WphA.text: This is my go-to hangout on Camden Passage: a lovely, cosy cafe with really chirpy and sweet waiting staff and great music. It's almost always bustling - but you can easily sit down with a laptop (they've got free wi-fi) and read a book with a cuppa. I'm giving this place 4 stars because the service is great - with these kind of hipster venues, there's a danger that the waiting staff don't give a rat's ass about you and look like they've just come off a 4-day ket bender and have barely squeezed into their skinnies in time to come in for work. The Breakfast Club staff all look happy to be there - I've seen waitresses singing to themselves, and when one waitress messed up my order, she threw in a free pot of tea to make up for it. The pancakes are great, and so are the veggie breakfasts. Warning: The lines here for brunch on weekends are ridiculous, so you might want to head somewhere else.

IpQYI5bIo3FzJTyVUTkFWg.text: Anyplace named after my favorite movie in the world automatically gets 3 stars from me. The fourth is because it's so. good!The Breakfast Club is as close to an American diner as I've found in this area (No...Tinseltown on St. John doesn't count. See further reviews on their page.).What makes them spectaconderful? Really good smoothies, amazing wraps, and good breakfasts. The decor is an eclectic mix of 80s memorabilia and just RANDOM stuff. My absolute favorite thing about it, above all, is the music they play. It's a throwback to the 80s and early 90s goodness that makes me super super happy to have been born in time for it. Seriously, you will end up singing along to such favorites as MJ, Madonna, Bananarama and Heart. The waitress laughed when she caught me rocking out to Dirty Diana.Don't try Sunday morning, go for dinner on a weeknight and you'll get to choose where you sit.

J-LZxLAAsoRB4N_1223eAg.text: My fellow American expats were craving a proper casual brunch.  We tried the Breakfast Club in Soho last Sunday.  They were packed and on a wait the entire time we were there.The verdict...Service; good. Fairly attentive and friendly, accurate wait time (15 minutes) given at the door and apologies (unnecessarily) made for us having to wait at all.Coffee; no filter coffee here, but a very nice Americano. Strong & tasty in a large cup.Food; came out very quickly, everything was as ordered and tasted good. Vegetarian "sausage" was more like a non-falafel spiced falafel, but good in a non sausage kind of way. Regardless, as someone who doesn't eat pork I appreciated the option. Pancakes were pretty decent, the topping was really good.  All in all very satisfying.  Portions were very large, none of us finished our plates... and I'm generally a "clean plate" kind of guy.Prices; very reasonable for London. Now that I know what to expect, I'd probably order a little less food and it would be a good bit cheaper.Definitely going back for brunch in the future.

3JpB10taf2PTq4KJuJ2hzg.text: After MANY brunches in London I finally found the Breakfast Club! It's a really cute venue, packed full with tables and chairs but it still feels comfortable and light. I ordered the pancakes and berries which came dripping in maple syrup and with a dollop of cream. The only disappointment was that there were not very many berries so I couldn't really convince myself I was being healthy... But the pancakes were delicious and even though the plate was huge I had no problem finishing them all. If you like sweet things for brunch this is place is ideal.

b5wvJ1LmBHwxD31mwq2rVg.text: Bad service, Food was distinctly average.. Couldn't understand why it was so busy.There are much better places in Angel very close.. Such as Elk in the Woods.

yl99Wq-mOx1eKLWm6ugQzw.text: As a big fan of The Breakfast Club café in Soho, I finally made the trek to check out it's sister café in Hackney.  And it was fab. Casual, original and super-comfortable, The Breakfast Club is the perfect place for...breakfast (duh!).   They do a great range of all things breakfast/lunchy, with eggs done lots of ways, porridge, and a range of really tasty sandwiches.  Servings are generous, prices all under a tenner and coffee pretty good. Definitely check it out.

UGrw8poyOS0KdyZ2TBLu6w.text: It's okay. The food is merely average "American" breakfast fare. The coffee didn't make me recoil with disgust. The atmosphere would have been quirky in 2005. The value for money is not entirely reasonable. Overall, I wouldn't begrudge a person who claims to enjoy eating at the Breakfast Club, but I would probably silently judge them a little bit whilst nodding my head indulgently with a half smile.You've gotta be a chump to wait outside in winter temperatures for 45 minutes to get a table, though. There are a lot of chumps in Islington.

fSDGWhwqh8k9zjm7IG1rmA.text: The five stars may be because I am emotionally attached to this place but if you exclude the fact that it is small and gets long queues in the weekends it is the most adorable breakfast place I've ever been to. The atmosphere is very friendly and the service is always very nice even on the busiest day!I almost always take the American Breakfast which I love but I've heard that the English Breakfast is really good too. Do try as well the amazing juices and smoothies or go for the mouth-dripping Peanut Butter Banana milkshake!!!The Breakfast Club in Soho in my opinion is as small and busy as the one in Angel but has less of atmosphere and cosiness. If you would like the same food and service quality but hate to wait forever to get in go to Breakfast Club in Hoxton Square.

lLLLowWHy8kNgHmOAoio8g.text: Cute concept.  Breakfast was pretty good. Maybe not worth the wait but fun to try if you missed rush hour. Get the Bloody Mary.

lpOmxyO6LD7W0KjLb8hiZQ.text: Let me start by saying that serving badly prepared American food does not make this an American diner. Not even a little bit.For starters, my server didn't write down our order, then got it wrong, then charged us for the pleasure. Lovely.Our table had been wiped down right before we were seated, and there was a layer of grey water all over the surface. I sopped it up with a paper napkin and it came away soggy and grimy. Charming.On to the food...The pancakes were a crime against flour and eggs. They were...crunchy? Hard? Whatever they were, I literally could not cut them with the side of my fork. The bacon was cold, the potatoes we're NOT hash browns at all, and they were soggy! If you want to market yourself as an American diner, learn the basics and learn to do them right. Pancakes have got to be the easiest breakfast item to cook and they are so fast to make! There is no excuse for making them in advance and reheating them.I will not be going back, needless to say.

Y2NB90pr1gExC_aRtoVEUA.text: I'm a fan as the four stars suggests. Yes there might be a queue- but my tip is go as a pair! I went last weekend and managed to queue for just 15 mins before being escorted past the long queue of groups and families... in fact by the time I finished my breakfast the family queuing in front of me initially had only just sat down.I can't seem to order anything but pancakes with maple syrup and bacon .... oh gosh they are incredible, so naughty and what a flavour combo with the salty bacon and sweet syrup.... the PERFECT hangover cure! All finished off with a glass of freshly squeezed OJ and a latte. I had only had 4 hours sleep the night before and this breakfast certainly sorted me out for the day! Highly recommended.

vlxxJOVJDIZfpP0B6Tfywg.text: Great idea, poor execution.  I remember coming here years ago and quite liking it, but my recent visit was really disappointing. In my opinion this place is overrated. People come here for the atmosphere, which is really just kitch decor and decent music. In reality, this means a ton of dirty antiques sitting on your table. The menu looks enticing, but the quality of the ingredients and presentation is terrible. Customer service is also extremely slow and not very inviting. I want to love this place, I really do, but unfortunately that's no the case.

eqJk3wUFdFr92M0tmke8pg.text: you've got to get the "full monty" it's big but tasty.  I am surprise I finished the whole plate by myself.  (the full size)everything on the plate is so good.and try the brunch cocktail it's great!

SVEJ1uRusMpboswHAWelxQ.text: Hmmm I don't think this place is worth the wait.Which says a lot really as there is mostly always a wait...Standard 'American Brunch' served all day... blah blah blah I could have gone to Tescos at the top of Camden Passage, gone home and cooked myself pancakes and eggs on toast before all you lot waiting in line have so much as seen a menu.If I could saunter straight in to sit and order, I'd be kinder writing this I think. The food after all is decent enough. But the ludicrous queueing makes me cringe concluding that Londoners don't know what good brunch is...

J5v6G_Ke3qMqgaJWZLbEzQ.text: Small little place that you could walk right past, except that it was bright yellow, which can catch the eye. There was a line waiting outside the door, so you know at that point it has to be good. So we waited probably like 30 min. And I gotta say, well worth the wait. Once we were in, we were placed in pretty close proximity to the other diners, but the place was so small this was necessary. It would've been a much longer wait if this was not the case. Anyway, I got the breakfast burrito, which was the best decision of my life. So filling. So delicious. Fantastic hang over breakfast. If I ever come back to London, I'm going again for sure.

-4-NkDdTUh_fTaXer-zlwQ.text: AMAZING food!! Go there for the best burgers in town, great quality & taste. Also so good cocktails and smoothies / milkshakes. Only mistake you can make is not going there!

MFIP6TtXgac4zDwwG4_t9w.text: Great breakfast place! Variety of Egg Benedict. The Huevos de Benny is a must - an eggs benedict with chorizo. Get a smoothie too!

5-u-ATs9yqckOaJ2O8YpSQ.text: I'm torn between 4 and 5 starsMy favorite part of breakfast is the cupcake; hey now, it's never too early for that! Their cupcakes have the best frosting I've had in London.  It was fluffy, not too sweet ,and just the perfect amount! The cake, however, was a little dry but still close to perfection. The Breakfast Club offers a perfect mix of delicious breakfasts,  sandwiches, and cupcakes.  For me the eggs Florentine is simply perfection.  The english muffin perfectly toasted, poached eggs a bit runny, and the hollandaise sauce yummy and buttery.  Beware: the lines are long and the service is a bit slow, but I definitely think it's worth the wait. I can't wait for another eggs Florentine. Gnomes at the front of the restaurant and quotes from the movie The Breakfast Cub posted on the walls give this restaurant a cozy and quaint feel.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Yummy cupcake from the Breakfast Club

vonObRByfA4pplXTkqEVXQ.text: I just don't understand the bad reviews this place is getting, but then again I don't understand why people eat an English breakfast so let's just agree to disagree. This place is good!  When I want more than an omelette and chips from my local cafe, The Breakfast Club fills all my needs.  This Angel location is perfect to start of your day with a cozy meal in the sunny back room  before heading out to shop the day away. The menu is huge with a TON of breakfast options including a laundry list of breakfast combos, sandwiches and tasty egg dishes.  They also serve up smoothies, and amazing iced coffee.My go to dish is the eggs florentine.  I've always had perfectly poached eggs with just the right amount of hollandaise and yummy sauteed spinach.  Best so far I've had in London!  The staff is friendly and the tables are cozy but be prepared to wait in a hefty line on the weekends or hit TBC up on the week days or off-peak hours.

nmGLLbFmPrHWacth0vuWNA.text: The queue I was prepared for, so I was fine with that.  There is a queue, it's how this place runs.  No big deal.The service, that I was not prepared for.  Despite being at the front of the restaurant, next to two tables that sat down at the same time as us, those two tables were served before the waitress remembered to take our order.  We had to get our own menus, jump up and down waving to get our order in, and then our water never appeared (they'd run out of glasses, and then it was forgotten...by that point, we'd given up -- also, we really just needed to get out by then.  Sort your ventilation out BC, sitting in the window on a warm day is genuinely uncomfortable).The place still gets 3 stars, because the food really is good and when we finally did order, it arived relatively quickly.  Also, I was with good company, so the waiting wasn't as painful as it might have been.

F8SNbud2HLv3ARNZpqJhxA.text: If your after a "proper" breakfast, then this is the place.If your craving pancakes and syrup, this is the place for you.Quirky, fun, and in a fantastic area of Angel. A little on the pricey side, however defiently worth the cost. Only wish the coffee was refil.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

ve5h7Fh1wmN-ro8Yta7QHw.text: HANDS DOWN  - one of my absolute favourite places to eat in London. Their French Toast with Apples and Cinnamon is fabulous, and their peanut butter milkshake is great!I adore this branch in particular as it is in one of my favourite London haunts - Angel- and Camden Passage is a quaint old little street full of little stalls - and a vintage market if you go on a saturday. Its the perfect place for a post-breakfast-club walk in the London sunshine.The staff are always super friendly and happy. I would advise to get there before you are starving, as there is almost always a queue as they are extremely popular (and for good reason too!)

k-vzZYgzNJ2hbDILkSmtUQ.text: Love the Huevos Rancheros. Friendly, helpful staff. Always busy and plenty of atmosphere. Expect to queue to get in at the weekend! That's the problem with popularity.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Coffee before the Full Month

OjiO3b0H3cl16MIM2jmhgQ.text: I don't know why there's so many negative and average reviews about this place! most of them are probably snobs that wouldn't know a good meal if it smacked them directly in the face!!!! you gotta have the big bad burrito...I had the chicken one and it was INCREDIBLE  and the fresh apple juice was marvelous!!! i had 2!!!!! this is the kinda restaurant I will repeatedly come back to and get EVERYTHING off the menu...next time I'm going to get the spicy mac n cheese...had me salvating when i simply read it off the menu!!!

TC-YeB3avZTq-aGDqyzhrg.text: As an American from San Francisco, the Land o' Brunch, this is, unfortunately, one of the few places in London that come close to doing brunch properly. I say 'unfortunately' due to two things:1. I live five minutes from the Camden Passage location, and on the weekends, the wait is easily over half an hour. And on a cold, rainy Sunday, you feel every minute of that in the wet cobblestones beneath your feet. However, I always feel like complaining about wait time is silly--a place shouldn't be penalized for popularity, right? They can only do so much in a limited space short of rushing patrons in and out (which they thankfully don't do, something you appreciate once you finally get in). (So maybe I should strike this point? Hmmm.) Also, they delivered pretty little shots of hot cocoa with a perfect little marshmallow to the waiting line, and that was sweet beyond sweet. So, okay, I officially take back this con.But Reason #2 must stay:The Eggs Benedict (in any of its myriad versions). Maybe I'm alone here, but one of my favorite parts of eggs benedict is the moment when you pierce the poached egg and the yolk rushes down, coating your hollandaise-laden ham/spinach/salmon and english muffin with a beautiful yellow fountain of sweet delicious heaven. I LIVE for this moment at brunch-time. I cannot get ENOUGH of this moment. I will sometime pierce each egg as slowly as possibly just to see how long I can delay the volcanic rush. But the Breakfast Club steals this life pleasure from me, every time--their poached eggs are overcooked and the yolks are always hard. And nothing brings me closer to flinging a plate against a wall more than a hard-cooked poached egg. I find this a tragedy of epic proportions. And I've never been bold enough to send it back, because I always worry the chef will 'gift' my next plate, and hollandaise could hide a LOT. Also, there was some wimpy little salad leaves tossed onto my plate to make it look full, but they were dry as a desert and definitely looked like they were on their last legs. It was like where salads go to die. Also, there was a cold, cooked piece of egg white that I found at the bottom of it that sort of freaked me out. Didn't stop me from eating it (there are few things I won't put in my mouth), but still, WHOA. I did pause, which says a lot.That said, there are pro's (obviously, since I keep returning): my friend got the Ham So Eggsited yesterday, and the layers of ham, cheese, and fried egg between the maple-syrup coated pancakes was literally TO DIE FOR. * so * * good * I may have to give up my failed benedict and start getting this instead. Also, the menu is a proper-brunch menu--from breakfast burritos to designer pancakes and french toast. This is something I value and treasure. I'm just waiting for the day they do bacon waffles--and I do mean streaky bacon, and I do mean cooked into the waffle. Oh, and their bloody mary's taste like burning. I love it, but some of our party couldn't drink theirs--apparently they didn't like their noses running and throats on fire? (Wimps. Should've ordered them less spicy.) A mimosa on the menu would've been great, though, and a Ramos Fizz wouldn't go amiss.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Because you can never have too many street views. Oh, wait.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

_XtaYC3yu8JewcOAZ8kM8w.text: Breakfast Club can't be bothered to open on time for breakfastI know the food is good because I've had it before. But for a place that lives and dies by its reputation for serving breakfast, they have a terrible attitude to serving it on time.Pretty much every place that serves breakfast in London, from the greasy spoon on the corner to The Wolseley opens at 7am on a weekday, in order to serve people breakfast at a time when people want eat it. TBC Camden Passage, on the other hand, thinks 8am is more appropriate.While that's probably a terrible business decision, it might not be that bad if they did in fact open on time. Instead, I arrived at 7.45am, was told to wait until it opened at 8am, and then came back at 8am to be told that the manager had gone off somewhere and would be back to open up some time in the next half hour. The lackadaisical air of the chef who told me this suggested that this was not an isolated incident. They could not have been less interested in my business.Get. It. Together.

JR2fGduZgiCLwFk0_2oGZg.text: Pretty bad service. Queues always take absolutely forever. Definitely don't come here on the weekend unless you're in the queue before it opens. There are better places for brunch in angel.

aKmLd9ax1Q43UTzBUWiodg.text: You've been warned - the summer weekend queue is a beast. However, for a relaxed brunch, its not a problem, especially considering you're waiting in Camden Passage, which is an awesome little part of Angel. To the food, very american and very good. It is a bit pricey, but standard for Angel.

X7Nb14XZCtzraGgIXVG80w.text: Breakfast burrito!!!!!!!The wait is worth it. There's always a line at the Breakfast Club, no matter what location you go to. And that's because it is so good. The ambiance of the restaurant is amazing. It's like an American diner, but more hipster and more adorable. The walls are covered in '80s memorabilia that warms your heart. And the food is just amazing. I've only been for breakfast, but I loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast Club in Angel

bwu_JH4X45JDcht0R7kN3Q.text: This place is a great spot to come to for brunch.  The food and coffee are delicious and the interior is really fun.  My friend had the fry and I had the Bircher muesli and both of our meals were really good!  We also had cappuccinos and they hit the spot too! The line to get in is long if you go at brunch rush hour but if you're with a friend then it's fine as it's extra opportunity to catch up!

9kxSEIDXyv9XYJJQPeJVjA.text: Came here on a saturday morning with an empty stomach and i did not expect to see a line that stretched about the length of 3 buildings outside the restaurant.... which turned out to be a bearable 20 minute wait. While i  have to say the items on the breakfast menu itself were good, it was not THAT impressive but what really was amazing were the pancakes. One of the best I ever had as  it felt really doughy (is that even a word) and not foamy like the other pancake joints around town. The portions were huge as well, all in all it was a really satisfying breakfast but next time, come a little early if you're hungry, you might have to wait.

TSSBIJJJ0NTPPRC1Kbkf6g.text: If you like dough of any kind, you'd love this place. But I don't, so for me it is really difficult to get anything out of the menu without making a fuss.Don't get me wrong - waffles and bacon with maple syrup is super tasty there, but not exactly suitable for any kind of gluten sensitivities...Drinks are amazing. I love their virgin cocktails and fresh mint teas, fresh juices etc.Service is super nice, attentive, friendly and fast.

XMtIkmist2OJ9IZrjnmbyg.text: My husband I went for a late breakfast/lunch on Tuesday. I have aways seen a long line on Saturday during the antique market and been wanting to try it out! We had All American Pancakes and Apple Cinnamon French toast. I liked the good service and the terrace seats, but I could not figure out the reason why people are lining up for!!! The pancakes were ok, but rather tasteless, and the porched eggs were bit hard.... Plus, the French toast is made of just regular bread, not from brioche. To me, charging 7 pounds for something so ordinary and tasteless was little bit unjustifiable.... As some reviews have mentioned, maybe they have better days when they make better pancakes, but I was quite disappointed because my expectation was really high after seeing the long line! My recommendation; walk around in the area since there are so many cute places on Upper street or on Essex road (well, Essex road does have few cute places for brunch, though fewer in number compared to Upper street.)

MxZah93qI-DnIxE6xJii8Q.text: This place has always got people queuing outside but it is the biggest disappointment inside. Food is cooked to satisfaction, but it is very overpriced and the restaurant is overhyped for some reason. Tables are cramped and eating experience is not comfortable. Service is also slow. I wanted and expected the food to be wonderful but it was far from it..

V-78SPZ16xoDckdD1IjRdg.text: This place is fantastic. Loved the American style breakfasts but I wouldn't go here on the weekend unless your willing to wait in a huge line which hipsters in London love doing for some reason.

Pp7HSZlzwqhkpm5MT0RyjA.text: Coming from the U.S. I wanted to try a variety of foods during my stay here; but since it was my last morning in London I decided to try the Breakfast Club. It was an AMAZING choice! Because it was a late Sunday morning the line was somewhat long, but even with an estimated wait time of 30 minutes we were seated around the 20 minute mark. I ordered chicken & waffles which was quite delicious, the chicken was soft and fried to crispy perfection, and the waffles were not too thick, which I also loved. The gravy, chili butter, and syrup were a great mix for the waffles. The Black tea was good as well. My boyfriend ordered the full Monty and lemon ginger tea, all of which looked great. I sampled the potatoes and they were delicious -- not too hard, and well seasoned. Lastly, I don't really like pancakes but my boyfriend ordered them, so I decided to at least try them... Them I ended up eating them all, whoops. The pancakes were so amazing that I'm sure that will be the next thing I order next time I make it to The Breakfast Club. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good brunch spot!

ScBAuqDkW8vxtx_j9Z16bQ.text: My husband loved the Posh Sausage Sandwich, and the atmosphere was fun, so I've thrown in an extra star.  Otherwise, this would have been a two star outing.  Not in love with this place.  Not in love.Worst breakfast burrito that I've ever had.  Salsa?  Fail.  Guacamole?  It was green, I'll give it that.  Sour cream?  I don't think so.  I can't even be bothered to go on about it.  My daughter's pancakes were tough, and we've had much, MUCH better pancakes out of a box.  I just don't get how this place is called the Breakfast Club and even bombs out on the pancakes.  Just a d@mn shame because this place has a great atmosphere and, if it had better eats, it could be a rockin' awesome spot.

Ntz2UEDrxDX7kg6C5ABchg.text: So it's Saturday morning and I'm in need of some serious comfort food. This will involve carbs, fat and my body weight in maple syrup. It can only mean one thing, The Breakfast Club. I don't love this place that's for sure. The service is low, the staff lazy and they insist on putting chives on top of everything savoury. What is it with the chives BC? They are like mini onion flavours, taking over my plate and ruining my yummy breakfast. But, once you have scraped off the offending herb, you'll enjoy some fabulous feasting. It's the UK version of American brunch, served up in kitch surroundings with a small side of maple syrup. So my tips to you are; prepare to wait, after 9am there is always a queue and secondly, tell them no chives!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

edNzz9-uJIgJjDtKuVe8yQ.text: This is my favourite breakfast club location. It's super tiny, so unless you go at off times, you're probably always going to have to wait.It's really haphazard in here - there are things EVERYWHERE, but that is obviously part of the charm.Service hasn't been fantastic each time I've been but then the people working here are always super busy so oh well.Their breakfast items are top notch - they do it well. I've had things off their lunch or evening selections and they've been truly uninspired and bland.Definitely don't try coming to this particular branch of the breakfast club with a big group, it's far too small to accommodate you.

R3fa48GTxbB-y-LlzrA0hw.text: As much as I hate to be 'that American', I really did want to see how London would recreate an American breakfast, so I gave this place a try!Decor: Fun, quirky, cute. It's yellow on the outside, c'mon- you know it'll be fun :) There's a wide range of music that plays too- some that didn't fit with the decor, but whatever. It's also quite small and it gets busy in the mornings!Food: My friend got the French Toast with Bacon and bananas and it looked CRAZY. (pictures up) Just typing this review reminds me of how interesting this combo is, haha. BUT, She ate it all up and said it was delicious!I got the eggs Florentine because i LOVE eggs florentine/benedict/salmon. The biggest criteria i have for these dishes though is that the egg MUST be poached well and the hollandaise sauce must be pretty decent. The BC got the sauce okay, but the egg was a bit overcooked. (I know, I'm picky...) I finished it all, but it was not the best I've had.I do love that you get your coffee in nice big home-y mugs though :)Bottom Line: It's a cute quirky place to go to breakfast with a few friends (especially good after a night out on the town!!) and to get an American breakfast fix!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. eggs florentine
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. french toast with bacon and bananas

3kvERL1zIuTdEOPnzhNrQQ.text: Excellent brunch spot. After having our patience tested in a not insignificant queue (hence why only 4 stars), The Breakfast Club proved to be worth the wait! I had two perfectly cooked poached eggs and a good strong coffee. Definitely one to visit if you're in the area.

SAGVw40OsPOwlUXIbGcflg.text: Not the biggest breakfast club on the inside, but plenty of seating outside in the summer. Great service and as always excellent food

kQcZDOpTGK_68ONOK3rcVw.text: I cannot really judge a place called "The Breakfast Club" without having tried its breakfast...However, I had drinks there, and I can say that the Smoothie was good, yet overpriced, the place was cosy yet a bit creepy, and the service was nice without being wonderful...Still, I'll try it for breakfast if there is no big queue as there usually is...

vRtO-eX-0NcNKl3PgTJjcQ.text: Weird, the line here was so long for three days straight that I figured it HAD to be good (I flew in from New York and stayed at the nearby Hilton across Upper Street).  Too bad, I wasn't the biggest fan.   I know, most of you are probably saying I shouldn't have tried to get an English breakfast at a place famous for their American breakfasts, but I didn't fly across the Atlantic to get an imitation Manhattan brunch!I was really not a fan of the "black pudding" on the full monty, and the mushrooms were portabella halves instead of regular mushrooms that I'd expect in an English breakfast.  I also came solo so they made me share tables with other strangers (to be fair they asked if that was ok).It certainly wasn't bad, but it's totally possible to get the same meal for half the price at any of the nearby hole-in-the-walls.

6luOOxSWvoSXq8OgC8WiRw.text: This place looks so cute from the outside, I couldn't help but wanting to go in.  A friendly guy in a Sesame Street tee and yellow cardigan welcomed us and sat us down.  As it was quite early, we only ordered a coffee.  The service was really good, and they were very attentive.  The coffee came in cute coffee cups, but sorry to say the coffee was pretty weak :( The menu looked really tasty, but we didn't eat any food, so for now it will have to stay at 3 stars based on the coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Waiter :)
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Entrance way
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla Latte

TIEaQBmXMstnVe5uf96z9g.text: It was my fault, I chose the huevos rancheros. Ordering something remotely Mexican in England? Why do I torture myself with this type of ridiculous experimentation? I should know better. . .My advice? Stick with the Full Monty (which I loved at the Breakfast Club Hoxton) and you'll do fine!

u7qnCUR_rxcF3M6j1HsH5w.text: As others have previously said, the queue can be long sometimes but it's manageable. We waited for about 20-30 min to get a table for 4. Others with a party of 2 were seated right away despite coming in later than we did. In my opinion, the food was okay. It was good but nothing too spectacular. I would give this place a 3.5 but decided to bump it up to 4 stars for the namesake and the 90s decor. Staffs were nice and attentive. Overall, very cute place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pork hash
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Iced tea

V6KBuHOJNijy-IO8zP_rcg.text: I was homesick for a breakfast burrito and Yelp said this place had some, so I decided to give this another go and took myself out to breakfast. It could've been beautiful, but they went over the edge with this thing. "Chorizo, scrambled egg, roasted peppers, Portobello mushroom, guacamole, cheddar and spicy pepper sauce."There was no mushroom in my burrito. And while the roasted peppers were nice and the chorizo good (though a bit greasy, as chorizo is wont to do), the eggs and "spicy pepper sauce" were *rough*. When I first cut into the burrito, it released a cartoon-like waft of hot sauce. It was like I'd been maced.COOL IT WITH THE TABASCO! It wasn't a spiciness problem -- that was fine. It was just so much all you tasted was vinegar and that tell-tale Tabasco flavor and you lost the flavor of the peppers and the eggs and chorizo. It really didn't need it at all. Without it, it would've been a better burrito. Just because it's an American-style eatery and its a breakfast burrito doesn't mean you have to choke it with Tabasco. I'd leave that to the diner to add.I'd also recommend chopping the peppers and chorizo a bit more for more flavor distribution, but hey, that's just me.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Unassuming breakfast burrito/tabasco assassin.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Huevos con Chorizo

TYFNSKs6ehlURnr6wDFyZg.text: I'm a fan of the Breakfast Club (both the movie and the chain of American restaurants). This branch of the chain is the closest to my house and it has become my place to bring visiting friends and family to try a full English breakfast (or full monty, as they call it here). It is also a fun place for brunch with friends, as the shop is filled with kitchy decoration and plays lovely music. The Islington branch is located in Camden Passage and can be easily identified by the giant queue that seems to be a permanent fixture out-front. Luckily, if you come here in a group, you can take turns standing in line and perusing the antique markets that are all up and down Camden Passage on the weekend. The Breakfast Club is a small space that is packed with tables. Their turnaround is pretty quick and I have never had to wait for tooo long. I love the food in this (and every) location of The Breakfast Club. They have a big selection of tasty breakfast food, available to satisfy pretty much everyone. From the healthy avocado and poached egg to the indulgent "ham so excited" (a stack of pancakes sandwiched with slices of ham and with melted cheddar cheese); It has uniformly impressed me with flavour. My favorite dishes have been the full monty, the fried chicken sandwich and the boston baked beans (bbq braised pork with white beans and a poached egg). Also delicious are the selection of drinks and cocktails. They have super tasty smoothies, amazing bloody marys and a unique selection of breakfast-ey-cocktails (i've had and enjoyed the morning mojito and the earl grey sour). I would give this place full marks for food but I have a few hesitations. 1) I think this place is sometimes wildly overpriced for what it is. There are a few things on the menu I see as reasonable, but many of the meals (particularly egg and avocado) as well as the non-alcoholic drinks are crazy expensive (as is the case at any Breakfast Club location. 2_ I have had a few iffy customer service experiences at the Islington location, specifically. I was unsure of how to queue (if you needed to put your name and number of diners in, before waiting). When going inside to ask, my sister and I have both been treated rudely by staff members who assume that we should just know what to do. This coldness has extended on a few occasions to service during the meal, when it can take ages for orders to get taken or you are not given enough time to figure out what you want. None of this stops me from heading there on a hungover sunday for bloody marys and tasty breakfast food...but my pocketbook can only take it every so often.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Boston baked beans and a Virgin Mary

9Jh-_IdCIlEvR7Dtz85AFg.text: Having finally made it to the infamous Breakfast Club this morning for an early brunch, I can say I was overall a little disappointed.Firstly, the queue wasn't quite so bad as I had envisioned. My partner and I waited around 15 minutes to get a table and we were served quickly. I ordered the pancakes with berries and vanilla cream, my partner opted for the veggie pancake breakfast. We both got an americano. We considered getting a juice or smoothie, but at £4.50 (average price) a glass it seemed a little overpriced. While (briefly) waiting for the food we had a look at the interior; this is a crowded little joint with some hipster memorabilia adorning the walls, loud (bad) music and many tourists clutching guidebooks or backpacks. The music was the most distracting thing, but the waitress turned it down a shade when I asked.When the food came, we were presented with A LOT of food. This is a good thing for some, but given that I left over half of the food in my plate I can say I would rather pay half and get a smaller portion. I have four big fluffy pancakes stacked up, covered in a sweet vanilla cream, blueberries, raspberries and strawberries and a generous drizzle of maple syrup. My partner's plate had pancakes, maple syrup, a veggie sausage, sautéd potatoes and grilled mushrooms. It looked pretty good but I wouldn't have been able to eat it so early. He rated the veggie sausages but also found the portion size too big.After eating we we quite quickly presented with the bill without having asked for it, probably to accommodate more people waiting in the line. Overall our bill came to around £23 and we didn't even get a juice on the side. In all honesty I cannot see why the Breakfast Club is so popular. Maybe it was great back when it was a "secret", but the loud music, crowds and prices are not great considering the other options in London. I'd far rather be somewhere where there's no rush to leave, where I can chill with a book or my laptop.

RuGQJDH93uYhv7wsb-8Gew.text: Don't drink caffeine? The Breakfast Club is a sure fire way to wake you up... loud 80's beats, bright walls littered with movie posters and green checkered tablecloths. It's full on, even without the long weekend queues.I ordered avo smash w a poached egg, a side of smoked salmon and a green juice to wash it all down. The food arrived SO quickly, like almost disturbingly quickly - way before my juice - and it was all cold. I think they must leave the avo in fridge.On the plus side... the service was A-OK and the menu is people-pleasing extensive. I'd pop back if I was in the in the area and ravenous but with so many incredible cafes in London and so little time, definitely not this trip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Avo chilli eggs w smoked salmon

fm5nBrHbje81J_Bv0YKpGQ.text: I think I'm in a good mood.  Holiday season, etc.  But also: I had a great brunch today.  A 5-star brunch.  So let's unpack it!Some things outside of The Breakfast Club's control were working in favour of a positive experience.  Like, say, that it was a really crisp December Sunday.  And it was dry.  So the 40 minute wait for a table for two was actually really pleasant catch-up time with a friend.We got a table for 2 and it was busy (peak brunching, all!) but also the service was great.  Someone sat us.  Someone got drink orders asap.  Someone else came 'round for food.  And it was good.  Here's some of the awesomeness, k?- soft scrambled eggs- eggy french toast- huevos rancheros that were pretty on-point.  The guacamole was weak, but that was the only point of "meh".  The beans and chorizo though?  DELISH CIUDAD.- chai lattes are full-bodied and creamy and topped with a little extra dusting of spiceDespite long lines, big points for never feeling rushed.  Oh, and for the amazing Usher / JT beats helping to add some sass to my brunch.My main ish is that if it weren't rainy that's an awful long line-up.  Oh, and just two single bathrooms which is kind of NOT A LOT during peak busy-ness.  Yelp note: ask and ye shall receive: REAL MAPLE SYRUP!

HQuvMuA4EIllW60J1wLBmA.text: Waited for about half an hour with friends for a table outside but it was a lovely day so didn't mind. Had the green drink which was so good! Nice texture and the mint came out nicely. Did not taste too green.I had the When Halloumi Met Salad Wrap and it was great. The balsamic reduction and the sunblush tomatoes richly completed the grilled, salty halloumi. It comes with  a coleslaw I didn't eat. My husband had the Hams So Eggcited and said it was quite good; the silver dollar pancakes were not as quite as he makes at home but still decent. Our friends had the All American and smoked salmon and it drew rave requests. Good service as well. The only reason for not having a final star was because the food was very good but not amazing.

xanQMNoi6TjAPnoJagYK6w.text: If I could give 3.5 stars, that's what I'd give. The food was solid, though nothing too stand-out. I had the pulled pork sandwich, which was a great combination of a pork sandwich, potatoes and coleslaw. Having said that, I feel like the pork could have been better seasoned. Service was rather disappointing. It was slow, and the staff couldn't have been less enthusiastic to serve. The ambience was hipster and artsy. Downside is that it's small, meaning there could be long queues during peak times, so be sure to budget enough time. Overall, a good brunch place, but with room for improvement.

PTtxatSWFxVkuFjqxIdJIQ.text: The breakfast club at London Bridge is far better than this.Service was very good. Waiters very friendly and polite. However food was not as good as other breakfast club. Place is very small. Not many seats like other clubs. I usually like breakfast club but I did not like this one because of food. In my salad bread was look like old and avocado was not mashed properly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

2Ai5yFKhsOuNr4pNEb5-Lg.text: Went there this morning. Impressed with the ambiance and cozy design. Food are good. It was as good as what they bragging about. The service and server were very good. Last but not least, wifi... Fast enough. Price... Not shabby.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Good food. Very good one actually. Good vibe with a nice service also. Wifi yes!

PYmijf0xhybCFbNC7bFEgw.text: Wasn't much of a fan of my english breakfast here. Can't tell if it's because they didn't make it well, or perhaps I just don't care for english breakfast. The staff is nice and I did the 90's alt rock they play.

508_pNKWa-8MYMYOmhWnYQ.text: Came on a Monday after work - no queue so that's a good time to go if you're worried about queueing!That said, I was a bit disappointed. I've been to the Breakfast Club in London Bridge and really enjoyed my meal. This one was rather bland. I had a chicken burger - perhaps my problem was not having a breakfast option?! It also came with tomato on it, which I hate and I resent it when restaurants don't detail things like this on their menu. In addition, the room itself is small and less interesting than the other BCs I have been in or passed through. However, we really enjoyed the bingo that made up the evening's entertainment. I think it happens once a month? It costs £5 and involves three games and a lot of shots. I'd go back again, but only on a night with entertainment going on.

St4FpaX6ndMAJzrNFzAdEA.text: Their shit is clearly the good kind, because the place is packed! You either get there early enough to say "Top o' the mornin' to ya' laddies!" or late late lunch, when people with jobs and such are not having lunch. The place is like a beehive, buzzing with loud talk, fast food, good music, and generally a very hungry energy. We were not hungry, we went there to stuff our faces with pancakes. And everybody knows you don't need to be hungry to eat pancakes. When I saw their menu I suddenly got a Sophie's choice kinda feeling. I looked around and everybody had delicious looking stuff on their plate! Huevos rancheros, Pulled pork sandwich served with fries, Eggs Benedict, Eggs Florentine and oh Lord, The Pancakes!. So we got the Eggs Benedict and The Pancakes & berries. My boyfriend had the coffee and I had The Slow Boy juice (Apple, Carrot, Orange, Ginger). And boy, was it slow! They kinda forgot about us for a while, it was clearly a mistake that doesn't happen very often and they handled it perfectly. They took responsibility for the mistake, apologized, served us promptly and said that the bill is on them, because we had to wait for so long. 10/10!The food was amazing! The eggs were just how The God of Eggs intended! Poached to perfection, placed on a toasted English muffin dressed in ham clothes, topped with creamy hollandaise sauce and sent off into the world! And right when I'm about to say that there just is no better way to a breakfast-loving-heart, the pancakes and berries appear like a gift sent from heaven! 'Cause why else I am hearing angels sing?! As fluffy as a bear cub's bottom, as chewy as Chewbacca and as sweet as a squirrel in the snow (a bunny would have been too sweet, a squirrel is perfect), these pancakes are the past, the present and the future! And if that wasn't enough sitting on top of this glorious stack of happiness, is a luscious vanilla cream that sits there like lipstick on a pretty girl's lips. Effortlessly. Like it belongs. Like it's been there since the beginning of time. You think I'm done? I am not done. On and around this mountain of joy, topped with a fat cloud of fat, berries of all kinds are sprinkled around. Like precious beads of freshness that bring out the very best in you. All of this sitting in a puddle of maple syrup, also known as the Elixir of life and love and all that is good in the world. So next time, I'm in London, you know it's gonna be pancake time! Oh, Lordy, Lordy! It turns out I do wanna roam again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The Pancakes and berries/ The stuff dreams are made of.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict on fleek!

OPXQg9wDmcBKEM8gVsAz6Q.text: Agree, over hyped. Anyone who has had brunch in north America will find this to be absolutely unspectacular fare. Not at all bad mind you, but definitely not with queuing for! Go if you can early, or if you want a neutral brunch spot, and you'll be happy with the regular offerings. But don't expect a brunch miracle.

MOu20ljqBYbRBnUaBLsgSQ.text: Part of a chain and perpetually has a queue  outside (unless you show up when they open or for dinner).The environmemt is really young and hip. The menu is comforting and the portions are huge!I deducted one star for not receiving any syrup or ketchup for takeaway. Really? You really expect me to have a bottle of syrup at home for your delicious pancakes?!

8lcHRENYfGTdRg4qSYboJQ.text: I must be the only person in London who isn't head-over-heels in love with this place. Luckily, I didn't have to queue when I went, but then again, I don't know who actually would! We went on a Saturday morning and service was perfectly friendly - the interiors are quirky and fun; strong appeal to families and hipsters alike. But the food was a bit of a let-down: my pancakes were disappointingly flat, flour-y and not great. I honestly think I make better pancakes at home, so when I go out for pancakes, I expect them to have, you know, a little extra "oomph". These definitely didn't.Glad I tried The Breakfast Club, after all the hype, but would I go back? Probably not. There are better brunch and breakfast options on offer elsewhere.

zeGa872pquu9Nv1NbaoTGA.text: Fortunately, my friend and I only had to wait 20 minutes to get inside (I heard that the wait can get up to 2 hrs!).  I'm not really sure why the wait would be so long because they pretty much serve a traditional, good ol' American breakfast and there is nothing extraordinarily unique besides the fact that their decor is themed after "The Breakfast Club" movie. Nevertheless, this place is cute and the food is good.  I loved that they had vegetarian options along with a variety of sides that can come with your pancake or whatever breakfast plate you choose.  It was a bit difficult to get our server's attention sometimes amidst the energetic chaos inside that cozy space, but she was kind so no big complaints there.  There are also some interesting shops and  street vendors to look around in that area.

96DEcMbj9bpMIoWMsOsgzQ.text: This a great place to have breakfast/brunch anytime of the day (up to 5pm). This is a crowd pleaser for all, though sometimes some items on the menu could be executed a little better. The eggs Benedict options are great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Featuring a latte, home made muesli & pancakes with bacon.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pastrami Sandwhich

D5kzG-18QDiN9aLjeWzntQ.text: Nicer and cosier than the one in Hoxton, The Breakfast Club is always a good option for breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner or middle day coffee.This chain's restaurants are usually very busy and bustling with people, but to our surprise, when we visited this one, it was almost empty and we didn't have to queue for ages.We went there for an early evening coffee, as it is a decent coffee for its price, and also had the brownie, which they serve with vanilla cream and fresh berries and it was delicious!!The staff was friendly and helpful all the time. They seemed to be having a good time doing their jobs!

fPDjL74gHBE_XS-lbkrQfQ.text: "Yay! I'm a fan." sums this up correctly!I think that this place is very over rated, but at the same time I wouldn't say no if someone were to suggest going! I've been here twice and not had to wait long either time to be seated. When I went last Saturday, there was a queue for about an hour but there were two empty tables outside. We asked if we could sit there as it was a nice sunny day and were told yes. We still had great service from the waiter, he was very friendly even though it was so busy. We also experienced a delicious smell from a nearby chocolate shop.I got the full breakfast pancakes, unfortunately, the potatoes were a tad undercooked compared to last time but the rest was delicious! I also highly recommend bacon pancakes with syrup and berries. Such a great combination!

W69DtqvnYI2NXko91caQHw.text: Great place.  The Disco fries are killer... and all of the food was great. The servers were friendly, fast and very helpful.  We'll be back.

0PA8t1afmqpMX84-a8xHRQ.text: This is a fun chain in London-the location in Soho has a TON of reviews and usually a crazy line at that location. This spot was a short walk from my Airbnb and wasn't nearly as busy but was delish!! I just had a breakfast sandwich instead of a full breakfast but I'm so glad I did. It was so tasty, and I loved the tea I got to have with this meal. The restaurant is in a fun little location with great skylights, and is easy for a few people but also totally fine for one. Check out if you're in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese, avocado and siracha mayo. Great combo!

oJkl4L0NxCM7ptj7A65ojQ.text: Excellent eggs, so so pancakes (lack a little flavor or maybe I'm just spoiled by Clinton St Bakery), bad veggie sausage but good chorizo. Cool little spot. Luckily we went at a good time and didn't have to wait.

JHQVb0OsMI6R-GxXVsnQmw.text: I was visiting Islington for work and stopped here just before heading home for the week. It's a cute and cozy little spot with a perfectly sized menu including both savory and sweet bfast. The servers were all super friendly and attentive. OutKast was pumping at 10am. I loved it. Had an egg and avocado breakfast sandwich that hit the spot. Perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

SRqIjuIHY3UsKeItIm2NXQ.text: Amazing restaurant!! Absolutely loved it! Especially since I hadn't had a "traditional" American breakfast in months! My friends and I (group of 8) received amazing service! The waitress was patient and nice, and readily checked in with us. The was a wait, but it was quick, especially as this is a pretty popular place. I ordered the All American plate, the fresh squeezed OJ, and the cappuccino. All of it was delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. The All American platter: sausage, crispy bacon, 3 stack pancakes, diced seasoned potatoes, scrambled eggs, and a side of syrup.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino had thick frothy foam on top! So delicious, and sooo pretty.
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Fresh squeezed! 2 friends and I split a pitcher (8.70) and we each paid 2.90, and we got maybe 3-4 glasses of OJ out of 1 pitcher.

FxvXCeTo7QSmb5KIpifq3w.text: I wish I could return easily, but I live in California.  I thought this place was great.  My likes traditional English breakfast and thought his was great, I had eggs benedict with salmon and it was terrific.  The service was excellant as well.

H_KQzkfCW6Yoi8OhMl3y4A.text: I was wondering around and the bright yellow facade caught my eye. As you walk in the door it's hard not to get lost in the eclectic decorations strung throughout. There is so much to look at it sort of feels like looking through an "I Spy" book.  If your able to score a seat in the front you can soak in the sunshine and people watch. Or if you sit in the back you'll have a nice skylight so you'll get natural light either way! & The staff are all super friendly! Onto the food, everything I've tried so far, from the porridge to the pancakes and berries are absolutely delicious! And you can't go wrong with a latte. So if you're in the area you must stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

VrW_DavINn6l10fpaC4Fkg.text: I so want to love the Breakfast Club but I don't think we'll be friends ...  this was the third branch I visited and again I am left feeling a bit meh.  The Islington branch is tucked away in Camden Passage, one of these secret little alleyways you just have to love.The menu is packed with guilty temptations, everything sounds amazing.  And actually looks really great, too.  My club sandwich was massive but every bit of it was just that little bit too tame.  If you're going for full-fat you may as well throw in some salt and pepper for good measure.  This sandwich was rather bland - the homemade coleslaw and miniature green side salad had more taste than all that chicken, bacon and cheese.What a shame, like I said, I really want to love the Breakfast Club ...

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Club sandwich
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Creative colour coding

zin2g6vwViuWO2EAKpr8Ng.text: i stop by the Breakfast Club around 6pm and order the Full Monty for my dinner. I would said it is an excellent place for breakfast, branch, lunch and dinner. The Full Monty is so good and I would recommend it to all my friends. The staff is friendly and the environment is very comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

xuU3msPJvLXjIINdUbc4Ng.text: Haven't Yelped In a while, but BreakfastClub reminded me why I Yelp. I Yelp to capture experiences and let the world know of them, be it good or bad. The breakfast was exquisite: great value for money. I went for the All American option, which I highly recommend. The balance of sweet and savoury was just right, customer service was top notch, and the vibe was just chill. We were lucky enough to come early and avoid the queues, but with hindsight it's definitely worth the wait. At a cost of approx £10. More than I'm used to paying for breakfast, but also more than I'm used to getting for breakfast, in terms of size and value. 5 stars worthy, no doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

3njzMQPWtDgDJzRNoZ11dQ.text: I had the chorizo hash this morning.  Such a big serving I could not finish it all, but I tried. The feta sauce it came with added the perfect touch.  My partner had the pancakes with berries and judging from the moans of pleasure, he enjoyed his.  If you want a filling and delicious breakfast.  Visit here!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Chorizo hash

2CTTgbJtRT6JqWbulw37hw.text: Excellent place for breakfast and branch! Try the "full monty" or if you prefer something sweet try the all American pancakes - just delicious. Cons: huge queues and no reservation can be made. The area inside is quite narrow - things are better during summer that you can also be seated outside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom

Eac5W1xIr7uXjLXGiPey5g.text: If you are looking for a massive amount of tasty breakfast food, then this will be your jam. It's not fancy, or frou-frou, but it's comfort food done well. I had the Veggie Reggie(??), and sadly couldn't finish the enormous pile of goodness (mushrooms, two slices of bloomer toast, potatoes, eggs, mushrooms, grilled tomatoes, baked beans. David had the FULL stack of berry pancakes w/ vanilla cream, and I dutifully tried to help take down the pancake mountain. We failed, but it was a sweet battle. We ate there around 11am, and didn't eat again until well after 8pm. They are not fucking around when it comes to breakfast.

DBdogz3oYjy_XZLB8NgdfQ.text: It was an around one hour wait time but it was worth the wait... I went strolling around the mini shops window viewing while we had to wait...Coffee was good the food was good the atmosphere with the hip music made me want to dance...lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Got seated after almost an hour wait..food was good.!!

emvX8I6o08jSpLsC-qPtZQ.text: Having stayed with a friend in Islington overnight, I found myself needing a place to eat for a bit of breakfast when my friend headed to work. Easy to find, it's in a nice little terrace behind the main road in Angel.  The place itself is quirky but I like quirky. The menu is extensive but I eventually went for the poached eggs on rye toast. I had that with the 'whiter than white' green tea. The tea was good, as were the eggs. As I was on my holidays, I decided to have a hot chocolate after my 'main' brekkie.  I was delighted when it came in a bright yellow mug with a smiley face on. It was good chocolate. The bill for all of the above cane to £12.20 which I thought was a little on the expensive side. I realise this is central London and maybe this is the norm. I will definitely go back next time I need breakfast in Angel. The only point of note is that my friend told me that there are often queues at the weekends. I was there at 8.30 - 10 am on a Friday and it was fairly quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Happy hot chocolate!

tOarbE1CcD47pcTnxjXiSw.text: I can see why they often have a line out of the door. Not because the food is so good but because the service is pretty terrible and so slow!3 of us got went and didn't have to wait as it was a Tuesday morning. Nonetheless it was quite busy inside but it's very small and cramped so there aren't many tables for the 2 wait staff to worry about but they still managed to go long periods without stopping by or looking in our direction. They got my fiancées order wrong but we'd waited so long she decided not to send it back. The food itself was actually very good, although I'd argue it's hard to not make a good sausage sandwich. My friend had the egg and avocado and porridge and he said they were decent but the sausage/bacon roll special is the way to go or the Full Monty breakfast judging by the table next to (almost on top of) us. As it's so cramped in there it's also really, really hot and we all left literally sweating. Waiting so long for our plates to be cleared and to pay didn't help. This place is comfortably a 4 based on food but the service really is bad. If there's a line I wouldn't bother waiting, try The Elk in the Woods next door instead.

uguUdAGK781yKYs5M_1IPg.text: Discovered this place my last morning visiting London. This was the first place I encountered what I considered "real" breakfast (one involving pancakes lol). Ordered the "All American" which was probably way more than one person needs to eat by themselves but such is the American way. Everything was delicious and fresh tasting and since it was a Tuesday I didn't have to wait for it. There's also free wifi you just have to ask for the password. Would definitely recommend this place if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Green is good smoothie. Delicious!
Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. All American breakfast

8pAYMpDNyU45X9MNNXa26Q.text: You should go anytime after 7pm on a Saturday because you'll wait for zero minutes and pretty much have the place to yourself. I ordered the stack of pancakes with berries and vanilla cream and a side of mac and cheese. The entire menu looks amazing though I hear they're famous for their pancakes and I can definitely vouch for the deliciousness of the stack! The mac and cheese left a lot to be desired. It reminds me a bit too much of the Kraft instant mac and cheese. Overall it's a pretty good place to go as a group and grab a bunch of food. We only paid £12 for the entire meal and we left happy and full to continue the rest of our night. Service was also friendly and fast - they were super accommodating and even though this is an America inspired joint, the bill doesn't arrive with a forced table service line item but feel free to tip them if you rate their hospitality!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. Pretty amazing spread of food!

BHyVGulK8zL0uWyQ1xhXVg.text: This place was great! I ordered the chicken and waffles and it was really good! I seasoned butter that came with it made the meal! I love the atmosphere of the place. It is very trendy and vintage. The coffee was good and the staff was friendly. I have no complaints!

G8PL5-gcWES4e-m1yacnZw.text: lovely staff and as always very good food. Prefer this one to the busier soho branch as that one is almost always so full and with some big queue outside. I'd personally recommend the veggie breakfast burrito, so filling and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of The Breakfast Club - London, United Kingdom. veggie breakfast burrito, pancakes & berries, side of Mac & cheese

m94xvIlTN3XmQqBNMDIOQw.text: Awesome selection of food and great vibe, although be prepared to wait at the weekend!

aCGI6jAXgnCGrah9uhgxBw.text: I had the pleasure of eating at this quaint breakfast spot tucked just off of Upper St. and had an utterly great, affordable, and bountiful breakfast that consisted of black pudding, potatoes, a banger, and a ton of other food that I can't quite remember right now.  I found this place just by walking around the side streets off Upper St, and I'm extremely happy I made to choice to go...will go back if I can.

BcrQ-BnKEjVwc_tLVWczYQ.text: Definatley good. Had to wait a while to get a seat, but, once in everything was sound. I particularly like going out for breakfast, it's nice been around when everyone else is dashing around trying to do something or get somewhere. Food was ok, had veggie breakfast and good coffee. In a word. NICE.

oGZTvUkfzeC-76ozk4sf4Q.text: We went to the Breakfast Club on a hot Sunday afternoon, with hunger and high expectations. Luckily, it was empty except for 2 tables, so no queue (quite rare, I've heard). After quickly being seated and handed menus, we were greeted by around 3 very friendly staff members in succession, each eager to take orders. Our drinks - 2 smoothies and a cider - arrived fairly quickly. However, after 40 minutes hallucinating in the heat and watching three other tables being seated, fed (full meals) and fare-welled, we'd grown a little bored of waiting for a cupcake and plate of potato wedges. Even the two staff members entertaining themselves with a rendition of Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes, while sipping cool, white wine, were becoming weary. Apparently, they'd forgotten about our food. Twice. Must have been the rush of blood to the head on Toes. Our meal, when it did arrive, wasn't too bad, and we didn't have to pay for the wedges. A free potato and super friendly (albeit slow) service are what got this place the extra star Go here to watch a musical and sweat, but probably not to eat.

402UomdFasHNlzSecQJiaw.text: Love the vegetarian all american. They also do really great fresh smoothies. They seem a little expensive on the menu, but you'll change your mind once you taste them. They're fantastic! Pancakes come with real maple syrup--which is rare in London. There are always long queues on the weekend, so arrive early.

6jJfaZyxomY0HARP1GLZpg.text: Delicious breakfasts and smoothies - an excellent hangover cure and nice place to hang out with your friends.

dw_QtsYlqR4XBixrFiY43Q.text: I've eaten at The Breakfast Club a couple of times, once for breakfast and once for dinner. It's a unique little place, and the small size means you often have to wait for a table. It's worth it though, with great food served by friendly staff and washed down by lovely smoothies or coffee. As the name suggests, the breakfasts are particularly good, with big portions and quality food. Definitely worth a visit.

mZ3raKhi7wQX_xXjkTAw5w.text: great place to go for brekkie!!!!! yummy!!!! great service!

t4nIEDJbWXp8QD0-JjjcSg.text: On a Sunday afternoon this place was predictably busy not to say overcrowded. Staff are rude (stressed?), the coffee bitter and the baguette soggy.

8K9V3-0A888m7rNstwaVOg.text: Really delicious breakfast, maybe little bit pricey but don't believe you could make the whole full monkey incl. sausage, black pudding, bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms, beans, mashed potatoes, toastgood to know there is a half full monkey on the menue as well. My friend had the alpen-muesli+greek yoghurt+berries and which was a yummy, too. I am just on a visit in london, so can't compare properly. It IS a good place for a cosy breakfast but could be hyped by timo out etc. So come early, about half ten weekends to avoid the queue.

efx9wuuRjZoITLeaoiX2Ew.text: Funky little place for breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea. Eclectic decor that has a bit of a Brighton feel. Try the green smoothy and be open for a pleasant surprise!

J7okI8ssGmbLScMPqpmIdA.text: We've been to The Breakfast Club in Soho a few times.  It's cute and the atmosphere is good.  The food isn't terrible, but definitely not the best in town.  Overall, we go sometimes for the novelty of the place, but it's overpriced for what it really is.
